climbs.name: Wedge, Regular Route
climbs.fa: Jack Davis, Bruce Fortine, and Rod Smith, June 1956

content.description: On pitch 1, an awkward starting move leads up into an easy chimney.  On pitch 2, easy stemming leads up to a scary step over onto a steep face.  A few moves up the face take you to the top.  Descend via two rappels (50 and 80).  This is a nice summit, but a poor route.

This is an obvious long ,right traversing dike route. A very cryptic crux past the second bolt will get you up to the start of the traverse. Theres a bit of a run out on good holds to get to the  shallow corner half way thru to clip a bolt and contemplate the second crux. Go all the way around the corner to Sun Dog anchors to rappel.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchors. Shares anchors with Sun Dog.
content.location: Start this route to the right of the gully. Three bolts get you to the start of the dike.

content.description: Climb the chimney to the right of the previous routes. The crux involves getting past the second bolt to get into the chimney. Classic chimney climbing past seven more bolts gets you to the top.Scramble to the right about twenty feet then climb up to the shelf above and then back left to the anchors directly above the route.

content.location: To the right of Sun Dog Chimney.

content.description: Climb the wide crack between Sun Runner and Sun Dog Chimney. Long and wide this is perhaps better than it looks.
content.protection: Scramble to the Sun Dog anchors.
content.location: Note the two bushes in the crack.

content.description: Climb a left leaning crystal dike with the first crux getting past the first bolt and clipping the second. Climbing past the fifth bolt where the dike ends it gets dirty and loose though easy. Scramble past a couple more bolts and chimney/ scramble to the anchors.
content.location: Directly below the wedge formation is this left leaning dike.

content.description: Top rope this route off of the Hair of The Dog anchors.
content.location: To the left of Hair of The Dog and directly below the rappel route is the Dogsbody. Start to the left of a large hole in the rock. Short people do a crimpy move to the horizontal , tall people go straight to the dike holds. Grab the horizontal dike and move left to the large plate of patina and mantle or pull yourself up. Stay just to the right of the ravens nest and climb the patina to the anchors.

climbs.name: Dog Eat Dog
climbs.fa: FA Dino Banco. FFA Yannick Gingras.

content.description: Up in a gully to the right of Hair of The Dog is this right leaning and overhanging dike route. Beautiful holds on perfect rock past 4 bolts.
content.location: Between Hair Of The Dog and Sun Runner up in a gully.
